org.haldean.chopper.server
Class DataReceiver

java.lang.Object
  org.haldean.chopper.server.DataReceiver
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class DataReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

A huge singleton class to receive data from the chopper that operates within its own thread.

Author:
William Brown

initialize

public void initialize(java.lang.String _serverAddr,
                       int _dataPort,
                       int _imgPort)
Initialize this DataReceiver object, destroying all previous state.

Parameters:
_serverAddr - The IP address or hostname of the transmitting server
_dataPort - The port to connect to for textual data
_imgPort - The port to connect to for images

setStatusLabel

Tie the component to a status label.

Parameters:
sl - The status label that represents the data receiver

tie

public void tie(Updatable u)
Tie an object to the DataReceiver.

Parameters:
u - Object to update on incoming data

tieImage

Tie the ImageComponent to the DataReceiver.

Parameters:
i - Component to update with new images

connected

Returns the status of the connection.

Returns:
True if connected to server, false if not

Tell the DataReceiver to break its connection to the server.
